main event: An object resembling a bright star was observed in the Pacific Ocean, moving slightly before disappearing on the horizon.
interesting points: The object was sighted moving horizontally and vertically about 5 degrees., The observation lasted for approximately 1 minute., The object dropped about 25 degrees over 35 minutes., It was likely identified as the bright star Sirius, magnitude -1.C., Misidentification was possibly due to unusual atmospheric conditions.
sighted object: an object with the appearance of a bright star
